class_notes:
(Same as MESAS 270 2 and HIST 296 2)
(This course aims at providing a survey of the development of Islam in Africa from its beginning in the seventh century to the present time. It provides a historical framework through which issues in contemporary Muslim societies in Africa can be analyzed and understood. It is designed to provide students with broad understanding of the processes of Islamization and the emergence of local Muslim cultures in Africa, including Northern, Western, and Eastern regions of the continent. It also aims at helping students organize their research, enhance their analytical skills and express their ideas in verbal and written from. This lecture course is organized as lectures and discussion sessions in which students will debate readings assigned for each week with the guidance of the instructor. They are also required to meet individually with the instructor during office hours and/or by appointment to work on personal research projects.)
course_description: An introductory course on African Studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
